item.title: Glenn add a quote by Henry Beston
item.description: "Our civilization has fallen out of touch with night. With lights, we drive the holiness and beauty of night back to the forests and the sea; the little villages, the crossroads even, will have none of it. Are modern folk, perhaps, afraid of night? Do they fear that vast serenity, the mystery of infinite space, the austerity of stars?" -- Henry Beston

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I like to see flowers growing, but when they are gathered, they cease to please. I look on them as things rootless and perishable; their likeness to life makes me sad. I never offer flowers to those I love; I never wish to receive them from hands dear to me." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Russell Hoban
item.description: "An idea is an eye given by God for the seeing of God. Some of these eyes we cannot bear to look out of; we blind them as quickly as possible." -- Russell Hoban

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Lewis Mumford
item.description: "A day spent without the sight or sound of beauty, the contemplation of mystery, or the search of truth is a poverty-stricken day; and a succession of such days is fatal to human life." -- Lewis Mumford

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Marlene Dietrich
item.description: "Love for the joy of loving, and not for the offerings of someone else's heart." -- Marlene Dietrich

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Pete McCarthy
item.description: "I reckon if I can't spend the day sleeping, the next best thing is to spend it reading and drinking." -- Pete McCarthy

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Pete McCarthy
item.description: "I like reading in a pub rather than a library or study, as it's generally much easier to get a drink." -- Pete McCarthy

item.title: Glenn add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Glenn add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "The world will never starve for want of wonders; but only for want of wonder." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Glenn add a quote by G. K. Chesterton
item.description: "There's a lot of difference between listening and hearing." -- G. K. Chesterton

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If a cluttered desk is a sign of a cluttered mind, of what, then, is an empty desk a sign?" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Glenn add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be." -- May Sarton

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Glenn add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Stephanie Klein
item.description: "Tell the truth, or someone will tell it for you." -- Stephanie Klein

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Glenn add a quote by François de La Rochefoucauld
item.description: "No persons are more frequently wrong, than those who will not admit they are wrong." -- François de La Rochefoucauld

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "The covers of this book are too far apart." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Sven Birkerts
item.description: "I often find that a novel, even a well-written and compelling novel, can become a blur to me soon after I've finished reading it. I recollect perfectly the feeling of reading it, the mood I occupied, but I am less sure about the narrative details. It is almost as if the book were, as Wittgenstein said of his propositions, a ladder to be climbed and then discarded after it has served its purpose." -- Sven Birkerts

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Sven Birkerts
item.description: "It is in adolescence that most of us grasp that life--our own life--is a problem to be solved, that a set of personal unknowns must now be factored together with the frightening variables of experience. The future suddenly appears--it is the space upon which the answers will be inscribed." -- Sven Birkerts

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "All the books we own, both read and unread, are the fullest expression of self we have at our disposal. ... But with each passing year, and with each whimsical purchase, our libraries become more and more able to articulate who we are, whether we read the books or not." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "Even bad times have good things in them to make you feel alive." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Glenn add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "I don't want anyone writing in to point out that I spend too much money on books, many of which I will never read. I know that already. I certainly intend to read all of them, more or less. My intentions are good. Anyway, it's my money. And I'll bet you do it too." -- Nick Hornby
